content.webTitle: Power plant transformed into head-turning art

fields.headline: Power plant transformed into head-turning art
fields.bodyText: For the 16.5 million travellers who make their way from Edinburgh to London down the east coast each year, Torness nuclear power station is an unmissable, if unremarkable, building. But the East Lothian power plant is about to become one of the most spectacular art installations in Britain. Ricky Demarco, a Scottish arts impresario, is planning to project art on to the huge structure. The first piece will be a six-minute film by the artist Ken McMullen, Lumen De Lumine, exploring the relationship between science and art. The film will run on continuous loop for a year.
